MLB voluntarily recognized the union in September and opened negotiations on the CBA. Players can also earn more if they are in spring training longer than 4 weeks or participate in instructional leagues.
New raises, per union official; Rookie League salaries escalates from $4,800 to $19,800 per year. Low-A: $11,000 to $26,200 High-A: $11,000 to $27,300 AA: $13,800 to $30,250 AAA: $17,500 to $35,800

Paul Goldschmidt having quite the game, driving in two more runs, and now USA is threatening to mercy-rule Cuba: USA leads 9-2, and if they have a 10-run or greater lead after seven innings, the game ends.

Alexis Diaz, brother of Edwin Diaz, doesn't retire a batter in the 7th and is pulled from the game with the bases loaded an no outs. Puerto Rico hanging onto a 4-2 lead.

Mets center fielder Brandon Nimmo left the game with right ankle soreness, the Mets say, and will undergo imaging Saturday.

Team Mexico starter Julio Urias out of the game after going four innings: 5 hits, 4 earned runs, 1 walk, 4 strikeouts. He threw 60 pitches, 20 fewer than permitted by WBC starters this round, but was never going to throw more than 65 pitches, preparing for Dodgers opening day.
Oh-oh. Now Mets center fielder Brandon Nimmo limps off the field in their spring training game tonight. The Mets need to wrap their team in bubble wrap until opening day
Javier Baez and Eddie Rosario got back-to-back homers off Julio Urias and Puerto Rico up 4-0 in the first inning over Mexico

Mexico manager Benji Gil says baseball fans would be watching the USA game no matter what channel it was televised, which now becomes disadvantage to Mexico robbing them of critical day off.
Attendance for tonight's USA-Colombia game: 29,856

Team USA is three outs away from advancing to the quarterfinals, but the reality is that they already are in. USA leads 3-2 in the 9th, and they would have to lose by 4 or more runs for Colombia to advance under the WBC tiebreaker rules. So even if Colombia wins, they still lose
Mike Trout with big 2-out, 2-run single, and USA takes its first lead of the night, 3-2, over Colombia. If they win, they play Venezuela on Saturday in the quarterfinals.
The Mets announce that Edwin Diaz will undergo an MRI on Thursday on his right knee.

Kike' Hernandez says Edwin Diaz was their clubhouse leader: "He has a really big bank account, but his heart is way bigger than his bank account is. He's one of the really special human beings we got in that clubhouse. .It sucks. ..It's a big blow in more ways than one. ''

Puerto Rico infielder Kike' Hernandez on clubhouse mood after Edwin Diaz knee injury: "Quiet. ... It's real easy to set aside the game and worry about us as humans. So it definitely doesn't feel in there like we just beat the Dominican Republic to advance.''
Devastating. The WBC is the first time Alexis and Edwin Díaz played on the same baseball team in their lives.
Heartbreaking seeing Edwin Diaz’s brother, Alexis, crying as the Mets All-Star closer leaves the field in a stretcher after injuring his knee in Puerto Rico’s celebration
New York Mets All-Star closer Edwin Diaz being helped off the field with a right knee injury after Puerto Rico just recorded the final out
Puerto Rico wins, 5-2, sending the powerful Dominican Republic home
Tim Anderson looks like a man who could win a Gold Glove at second base.
Mike Trout, who hasn't had more than two triples in a season since 2018, hits a stand-up triple in the first inning for USA tonight.
Team USA could actually lose by 3 or fewer runs to Colombia tonight, and still advance to the quarterfinals, but manager Mark DeRosa doesn’t want to hear it
Team Mexico 1B Rowdy Tellez, when asked his thoughts of watching teammate Randy Arozarena signing autographs during a pitching change in the game. ‘Hey, that’s Randy Arozarena.’’
The man of the hour: Randy Arozarena, who carried Mexico on its back to the quarterfinals
No surprise, but Canada manager Ernie Whitt announces that Dodgers All-Star first baseman Freddie Freeman is officially out for rest of the WBC with his strained hamstring
Cuba, who lost the first two games of the WBC, is going to Miami. They are the first team to advance to the WBC semifinals.
Ken Griffey Jr., Team USA's hitting coach, loving role in WBC

LA Dodgers ace Julio Urias will not throw a single pitch Wednesday in Mexico's critical WBC game vs. Canada. Manager Benji Gil: "I would love to win this tournament....but I have to protect his career. If he would come out [of the bullpen], I would tackle him to stop him.''
Attendance for Tuesday's WBC doubleheader at Chase Field in Phoenix: Canada-Colombia: 10,571 Great Britain-Mexico: 17,705

Great Britain manager Drew Spencer walked away proud and complimented everyone on his team for its gutty performance in the country's first World Baseball Classic. "I don't think people will see Great Britain on the schedule again in the future, and think that's our easy game.''

Mexico hangs on and beats Great Britain, 2-1, and now the Pool C scenario is simple. The winner of Mexico-Canada on Thursday will automatically advance to the quarterfinals. If USA defeats Colombia Thursday night, they will be the other Pool C team in the quarterfinals in Miami

Great Britain is threatening to send Pool C into utter chaos. They are tied with Mexico, 1-1, entering the 7th. If Great Britain wins tonight... And if Mexico beats Canada tomorrow afternoon .... And if Colombia beats USA tomorrow night.... There will be an insane 5-way tie!
Starter Taijuan Walker with a dominant outing for Team Mexico: 4 innings 1 hit 0 runs 1 walks 8 strikeouts.
MLB says it fully expects all games to continue to be televised by Bally’s in spite of Diamond Sports Group’s bankruptcy. In the event they are not, MLB will pick them up

Venezuela will meet No. 2 seed in Pool C in the quarterfinals, which currently is USA (Mexico holds tiebreaker advantage). The Winner of the Dominican Republic-Puerto Rico game will play the No. 1 seed, which would be Mexico (if they beat Great Britain and Canada in next 2 games)

The Dominican Republic wind 10-0 over Israel setting up epic matchup Wednesday night against Puerto Rico. Winner goes to quarterfinals Loser goes home. Venezuela now clinches top seed in Pool D and a quarterfinal berth.

The Diamond Sports Group, after filing for bankruptcy, says that the Bally Sports regional sports networks (“RSN”) will continue to carry the baseball games at this point while it goes through a restructuring.
Diamond Sports Group officially files for bankruptcy
One last workout for Team USA, with manager Mark DeRosa taking a few cuts, before they face Colombia on Wednesday night. If USA wins, they are off to Miami on Thursday morning
Great Britain manager Drew Spencer on their historic victory: ‘The feeling is absolute elation.’’
Great Britain celebrating its historic victory

Great Britain hands USA a gift by stunning Colombia, 7-5, for the biggest baseball victory in its history. Great Britain's victory means that Team USA is back controlling its own fate. If USA beats Canada tonight and Colombia on Wednesday, they will be in the WBC quarterfinals.
Attendance for today's Colombia-Great Britain game: 10,116
Seattle Mariners prized prospect Harry Ford goes deep, and Great Britain takes a 6-3 lead over Colombia. They are six outs away from winning their first WBC game in history.
Great Britain has scored five unanswered runs and now up 5-3 over Colombia entering the sixth inning.

RIP Yankees great Joe Pepitone. "As a native New Yorker, he embraced everything about being a Yankee during both his playing career_which included three All-Star appearances and three Gold Gloves-and in the decades thereafter,'' the Yankees said in a statement.

Great Britain comes back with a 3-run fourth inning, tying Colombia 3-3 entering the 5th inning. If Colombia loses, USA will control their own fate in the WBC pool by simply beating Canada tonight and Colombia on Wednesday, and advancing to the quarterfinals in Miami.
The Dominican Republic bounces back, beats Nicaragua, 6-1. Manny Machado doubles and homers. Next game: Team Israel on Tuesday.

The pitchers prohibited from appearing in today's WBC Phoenix games because of pitch counts: USA: Daniel Bard, Brady Singer, Nick Martinez. Canada: Cal Quantrill,Evan Rutcky Colombia: Nabil Crismatt Great Britain: Donovan Benoit,Akeel Morris, Andre Scrubb,Alex Webb, Vance Worley

It’s not just Team USA, but virtually all WBC managers are under instructions from affiliated teams: Texas Rangers pitching prospect Mitch Bratt is starting tonight for Team Canada vs USA, but will be pulled before the WBC-allotted 65 pitches, Canada manager Ernie Whitt says.

San Diego Padres star Juan Soto is in today’s Dominican Republic lineup, but can not start in back-to-back games, manager Rodney Linares says, because of restrictions by the Padres. He had left calf tightness his final few days in spring training camp, so Padres being cautious.
Joey Meneses, baseball journeyman, leads Mexico over USA in WBC with two homers, and becomes overnight cult hero in Mexico as fans celebrate
Bobby Witt Jr. 'soaking it all in' as Team USA's youngest WBC player
Team Mexico fans are still celebrating in downtown Phoenix into the wee hours of the morning, three hours after game ended
And 2 hours, 54 minutes into the game, we have our first 1-2-3 inning.

Tale of the tape after four innings of Canada-Great Britain game: 24 runs 22 hits 19 walks 10 pitchers Canada leads 16-8. Time of the game through 4 innings: 2 hours, 46 minutes. *There is a mercy rule that ends the game if a team leads by 15 runs after 5 or 10 runs after 7.

Seattle Mariners prized catching prospect Harry Ford with a 3-run homer for Great Britain, and the wildness continues. Canada 10 Great Britain 8 4th inning Time of game: 2 hours, 3 minutes and counting.
St. Louis Cardinals OF Tyler O'Neill with a 3-run double for Team Canada, and they are now up 10-5 over Great Britain in the third inning.
The first inning is finally over: Canada 5, Great Britain 3. Time of the inning: 46 minutes. Game pace: 6 hours, 54 minutes.

Wild first inning in the Canada-Great Britain game here in Phoenix. Canada 4, Great Britain 3. Combined pitching line for the two starters: 1 inning: 6 hits, 7 runs, 6 walks, 2 strikeouts. And it's still in the first inning: 31 minutes and counting.
Rough outing for Canada starter Cal Quantrill, who gives up three runs and is pulled with the bases loaded and two outs in the first inning. He threw 37 pitches. Great Britain up 3-0 in the 1st.
Smaller crowd today for Canada-Great Britain WBC game, but tonight’s USA-Mexico game is sold out at Chase Field in Phoenix.
Chicago Whitesox veteran Lance Lynn is scheduled to start Monday for Team USA vs. Canada

Cuba loses its first two games but still advances to quarterfinals along with Italy by winning 5-team tiebreaker. All five teams in Pool A: Cuba, Netherlands, Panama, Chinese Taipei finished with 2-2 records.
Japan has trounced opponents 35-8 in its four victories with pitching star Yoshinobu Yamamoto lined up to potentially face USA if they meet in Miami.

Sunday Notebook: Bobby Witt Jr. 'soaking it all in' as Team USA's youngest WBC player; Angels Opening Day plans prevent Shohei Ohtani from pitching vs USA in potential WBC matchup; Italy stays caffeinated in dugout; more.

For many years now (I'm not sure exactly how long), the committee has done a half dozen-plus contingency brackets to account for today's games. There are two games going on right now. They affect the seed ranking marginally, but it could be a big difference in bracketing.

The NET replaced the RPI because the RPI was purely results based. The NET is results based but features predictive properties like those used on KenPom etc. The NET is designed to be correct on Selection Sunday, when all the data is in.
Lots of misconceptions about the NET. It is an organizing tool. A team's overall rank is not all that important. It's reflective of what's important, but the rank itself means nothing.

First off, deciding the teams. Much of this is subjective. But most is not. The idea is to standardize the committe's decisions as much as possible. The final bracket will look very much like most of the mock brackets out there. Some differences, yes, but a lot more similarities

This is an incredible story from Ann Arbor by @Michael_Cohen13 . He was inside the Crisler Center for a meeting between Michigan and Michigan State like no other, one that went far beyond a game. And Michael summed it up beautifully. A powerful read:

MSU coach Tom Izzo: "All in all, we played the game for 2 hours. We played the game to try and make many people back in East Lansing and around the world escape for 2 hours and enjoy the moment. I thought for the most part, we did our part. They just did it a little better."

Izzo says he thinks MSU should get back to school Monday. "I don't know how you learn to deal with things unless you go through them. I think it's very important that normalcy regains itself. Yet don't forget what happens. That would be an insult to the victims."
Izzo: "I wanted to win it for every human being that went to Michigan State."
Izzo: "When you got a lead and you're winning, you want it to be a storybook ending. You want it to be like, where's the Disney director? Hoosiers or Rocky?"
